result.execSummary:
The defendant Casanova C McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ALL COUNTS: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges by 12/18/2017, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive, with credit for 10 days time served, straight time, forthwith.
**Court orders no release under any circumstance**
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

records.addlTxt: The Defendant's motion or request for release privileges is denied. The court intended te defendant to serve the sentence without release. (i.e. straight time). At the sentencing hearing the court specifically stated "No release under any circumstances." ; signed and filed. nm
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, calendar successor, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Casanova C McDonald in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 10 days time served, straight time, forthwith.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time, forthwith.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time, forthwith.

**Court orders no release under any circumstance**

-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges by 12/18/2017, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.


Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Victim Impact Statement
-Verification of Volunteer Hours
-Letter to the Court.

Defendant Casanova C McDonald in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requests adjourned Sentencing date due to medical reasons. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Casanova C McDonald in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. Court VACATES Jury Trial date.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

AS TO COUNTS 4 AND 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered counts 4 and 5 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

16RM053091  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10/07/2016
Speedy trial demand.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Casanova C McDonald not in court, in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.L.L. (9/15/92.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Casanova C McDonald in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Casanova C McDonald in custody.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
